com.azure.messaging.eventhubs

Class EventProcessorBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.messaging.eventhubs.EventProcessorBuilder

  • public class EventProcessorBuilder
extends Object
    This class provides a fluent builder API to help aid the configuration and instantiation of the EventProcessor. Calling EventProcessorBuilder.buildEventProcessor() constructs a new instance of EventProcessor.

    To create an instance of EventProcessor that processes events with user-provided callback, configure the following fields:

    • Consumer group name.
    • EventHubAsyncClient - An asynchronous Event Hub client the EventProcessor will use for consuming events.
    • PartitionManager - An instance of PartitionManager. To get started, you can pass an instance of InMemoryPartitionManager. For production, choose an implementation that will store checkpoints and partition ownership details to a durable store.
    • partitionProcessorFactory - A user-defined Function that creates new instances of PartitionProcessor for processing events. Users should extend from PartitionProcessor abstract class to implement PartitionProcessor.processEvent(PartitionContext, EventData).

    Creating an EventProcessor

    public EventProcessor createEventProcessor() {
    String connectionString = "Endpoint={endpoint};SharedAccessKeyName={sharedAccessKeyName};"
        + "SharedAccessKey={sharedAccessKey};EntityPath={eventHubName}";
    EventHubAsyncClient eventHubAsyncClient = new EventHubClientBuilder()
        .connectionString(connectionString)
        .buildAsyncClient();

    EventProcessor eventProcessor = new EventProcessorBuilder()
        .consumerGroup("consumer-group")
        .eventHubClient(eventHubAsyncClient)
        .partitionProcessorFactory((PartitionProcessorImpl::new))
        .partitionManager(new InMemoryPartitionManager())
        .buildEventProcessor();
    return eventProcessor;
}

/**
 * A partition processor to demo creating an instance of {@link EventProcessor}.
 */
public static final class PartitionProcessorImpl extends PartitionProcessor {

    /**
     * Processes the event data.
     *
     * @return a representation of deferred processing of events.
     */
    @Override
    public Mono<Void> processEvent(PartitionContext partitionContext, EventData eventData) {
        System.out.println("Processing event with sequence number " + eventData.getSequenceNumber());
        return partitionContext.updateCheckpoint(eventData);
    }
}
    See Also:
    EventProcessor, EventHubConsumer

        The updated EventProcessorBuilder instance.

      • consumerGroup

        public EventProcessorBuilder consumerGroup(String consumerGroup)
        Sets the consumer group name from which the EventProcessor should consume events.
        Parameters:
        consumerGroup - The consumer group name this EventProcessor should consume events.
        Returns:
        The updated EventProcessorBuilder instance.

      • partitionManager

        public EventProcessorBuilder partitionManager(PartitionManager partitionManager)
        Sets the PartitionManager the EventProcessor will use for storing partition ownership and checkpoint information.

        Users can, optionally, provide their own implementation of PartitionManager which will store ownership and checkpoint information. If not provided, the EventProcessor will first check for any available implementation of PartitionManager in the classpath and fallback to InMemoryPartitionManager if none found.

        Parameters:
        partitionManager - Implementation of PartitionManager.
        Returns:
        The updated EventProcessorBuilder instance.

      • partitionProcessorFactory

        public EventProcessorBuilder partitionProcessorFactory(Supplier<PartitionProcessor> partitionProcessorFactory)
        Sets the partition processor factory for creating new instance(s) of PartitionProcessor.

        Use this to have finer control over processing events from partitions. This will also allow you to control the frequency of checkpointing.

        Parameters:
        partitionProcessorFactory - The factory that creates new PartitionProcessor for each partition.
        Returns:
        The updated EventProcessorBuilder instance.

      • buildEventProcessor

        public EventProcessor buildEventProcessor()
        This will create a new EventProcessor configured with the options set in this builder. Each call to this method will return a new instance of EventProcessor.

        All partitions processed by this EventProcessor will start processing from earliest available event in the respective partitions.

        Returns:
        A new instance of EventProcessor.
